unit_learning_outcomes.description: Summarise and analyse, individually and as a group, key developments in health policy with an emphasis on legal and ethical contexts
Exemplify, individually and as a group, the key elements involved in planning, implementing and evaluating public health policies with due regard for ethical and legal aspects
Deconstruct the evolving cross-sectional nature of public health law globally and the effect on public health and health promotion
Define main terms in relation to key legal, ethical and policy aspects of public health
Exemplify the impact and influence of legal, ethical and policy concerns on public health both nationally and internationally
Critique the social, cultural, economic and political factors that can influence public health initiatives and the legal and ethical decisions underpinning these decisions

enrolment_rules.description: (130cp at 1000 level or above including HLTH200 or HLTH2000) or (130cp and admission to BHumanSc)

assessments.description: Group presentation on the legal, ethical and policy issues of a health topic, including an individual reflection report on the group work, group processes, and the health topic.
An 1800 word essay on health topic

data.unit_offering_text:
Session 2, Weekday attendance, North Ryde
Session 2, Special circumstances
data.subject_search_title: HLTH3500 - Legal, Ethical and Policy Directions in Human Sciences

school.value: Faculty of Medicine, Health and Human Sciences

data.description: This unit examines how law, ethics and policy affect population health in Australia and globally. Lectures and tutorial discussion will equip students with the knowledge and ability to engage meaningfully in debate and discourse surrounding the role of ethical and legal considerations and the policy process in health provision. Topics include debate around vaccination programs, infectious disease control, and the impact of corporate conduct on public health.
